rename.from: [Bug] After 0.16 update, Alacritty failed to start in any Wayland session (X11 works as is)
rename.to: [Bug] After 0.16 update, Alacritty fails to start in any Wayland session (X11 works as is)

body: I can reproduce, some Omarchy core features broke because of this

issue.title: Alacritty fails to start after 0.16 update
issue.body:
### System details

Omarchy 3.0.2

### What's wrong?

It looks like some core Omarchy features (terminal, install, setup) broke because of the new Alacritty version (0.16).

https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/8713

Downgrading alacritty back to 0.15.1 fixes everything.

rename.to: [Bug] After 0.16 update, Alacritty fails to start in any Wayland session (X11 works as is)

body:
What GPU are you running? If you are using hyprland, can you try a proper Wayland compositor instead?

For me with Sway I can't reproduce this issue.

me too getting same error after update. i have a bit old laptop with nvidia gt 525m. open source graphics installed. arch linux. wayland. kde. it was just running well before update.
``` alacritty -vv 
Created log file at "/tmp/Alacritty-9142.log"
[0.000000959s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Welcome to Alacritty
[0.000070002s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Version 0.16.0 (12082407)
[0.000096576s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Running on Wayland
[0.000456296s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Configuration files loaded from:
                                     "/home/rbs/.config/alacritty/alacritty.toml"
                                     "/home/rbs/.config/alacritty/themes/dracula.toml"
[0.039757564s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Using EGL 1.5
[0.039825819s] [DEBUG] [alacritty] Picked GL Config:
                                     buffer_type: Some(Rgb { r_size: 8, g_size: 8, b_size: 8 })
                                     alpha_size: 8
                                     num_samples: 0
                                     hardware_accelerated: true
                                     supports_transparency: Some(true)
                                     config_api: Api(OPENGL | GLES1 | GLES2 | GLES3)
                                     srgb_capable: true
[0.044000919s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Window scale factor: 1
[0.045427527s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Goodbye
Deleted log file at "/tmp/Alacritty-9142.log"
Error: Error { raw_code: Some(12297), raw_os_message: None, kind: BadMatch }
```

I can reproduce this on Arch with Sway, kernel 6.17.2, i7-3632QM integrated graphics.

Also, this seems to be the same issue as #8705 and maybe #8476.

Could be this? cd884c984bbd6a7c65965681083da61e091ff7e5 ? 

Will need a bit better log than what was provided, but it looks like it? Since nothing changed besides that thing.
Bisect would be really useful from someone who can reproduce. I can't reproduce on AMD (6900XT) or Mali. Seems like Intel/Nvidia might be affected to some degree?

I can reproduce the issue with an old Intel iGPU (`Mesa Mobile IntelÂ® GM45 Express Chipset (CTG)`, i915 driver, GLES 2.0, OpenGL 2.1)
Either forcing the usage of llvmpipe software renderer with `LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1` or forcing the usage of Xwayland with `unset WAYLAND_DISPLAY` makes alacritty to launch normally again for me

Here is the full logs of four different runs (0.15.1, 0.16.0 without workarounds, 0.16.0 with Xwayland, 0.16.0 with llvmpipe) if anyone is interested in it.
[alacritty-logs.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22988329/alacritty-logs.txt)

My intel GPU is not affected, probably some GPUs and somehow it ends up like that? It's rather strange.


Probably it tells that there's `ROBUSTNESS` but then, it actually says that there's no such thing?

```
diff --git a/alacritty/src/renderer/platform.rs b/alacritty/src/renderer/platform.rs
index 99778ea0..be83ef46 100644
--- a/alacritty/src/renderer/platform.rs
+++ b/alacritty/src/renderer/platform.rs
@@ -112,11 +112,6 @@ pub fn create_gl_context(
     let debug = log::max_level() >= LevelFilter::Debug;
     let mut builder = ContextAttributesBuilder::new().with_debug(debug);
 
-    // Try to enable robustness.
-    if gl_display.supported_features().contains(DisplayFeatures::CONTEXT_ROBUSTNESS) {
-        builder = builder.with_robustness(Robustness::RobustLoseContextOnReset);
-    }
-
     let mut profiles = [
         builder
             .clone()

```

Would suggest to try this

@kchibisov's patch seems to be working on my end

[alacritty-logs-2.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22988975/alacritty-logs-2.txt)

> What GPU are you running? If you are using hyprland, can you try a proper Wayland compositor instead?
> 
> For me with Sway I can't reproduce this issue.

I have an Intel Ivy Bridge iGPU, that's certain GPU's that missing ROBUSTNESS feature, as users there researched (in this case Alacritty doesn't work in any Wayland compositor, I have KDE Plasma, btw), with @kchibisov's patch, Alacritty works under Wayland again.
The thing is that we check that the extension is listed or not, so it's listed for you, but doesn't work.
Just in case, can you post a `eglinfo`?

By the way, here's mine:

[eglinfo.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22989766/eglinfo.txt)

Also, while researching about the `EGL_EXT_create_context_robustness` extension string, I found a somewhat relevant comment in the Mesa source code about the robust buffer access:
<https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/mesa/mesa/-/blob/main/src/egl/main/eglcontext.c?ref_type=heads#L191>
